subject: Programming
title: Continuous Deployment
description: A micro-lesson that makes Continuous Deployment usable.

hook.text: Amazon deploys code every 11.7 seconds. Every change that passes tests goes straight to production.

buildup.text: Continuous deployment removes manual approval gates. If the pipeline is green, the code ships.

discovery.text: Small deployments are safer. A change of ten lines is easier to debug than a release of ten thousand.

twist.text: Continuous deployment requires bulletproof monitoring. You must detect problems faster than users report them.

climax.text: Teams that deploy continuously innovate faster because the cost of each experiment approaches zero.

punchline.text: Ship small, ship often, ship safely.

quiz.question: How often does Amazon deploy code?
